description: From Middle English predicament, from Old French predicament and Medieval Latin prēdicāmentum, from Late Latin praedicāmentum (“that which is predicated, a predicament, category”).

entries.meaning: A definite class, state or condition.
An unfortunate or trying position or condition.
examples: Synonyms: tight spot; see also Thesaurus:difficult situation

entries.meaning: (logic) That which is predicated; a category.
